content: An error was made in transferring the profile. With more information, more assistance can be suggested. If you have a backup of the profile, I can assist in doing an install. The error is in the appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder. for a 'fresh install', delete the appdata\local\thunderbird folder and the appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder and then reinstall from thunderbird.net. start thunderbird once and then exit. At this point, I can assist in the transfer. Is your baclup of just the profile, or of the appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder?
creator: davidsk

content:
"Caldav" is a protocol for synchronizing calendars, and one.com is a web site host, so "caldav.one.com" suggests that Thunderbird is trying to connect to a calendar on one.com.

Who is your email host? Do you use Thunderbird's Calendar feature, and where is it hosted? You can check that by going to calendar tab, right-click on the calendar list in the left pane, choosing Properties, and examining the Location.

If this is something that just recently started up, I wonder if your hosting service is either having problems or is in the process of offloading some of their services, like calendaring to another provider.
creator: rednoise

content: I am confused on how you currently receive messages for the account. You are distinguishing the webmail provider from the provider. Please explain.
creator: davidsk

content:
Who is your email provider? Is this an IMAP or POP3 account?

It's possible that your local folder is corrupt. You can try Thunderbird's folder repair tool - right-click on the folder in the left-hand pane and choose Properties | General Information tab, and click the Repair Folder button.
creator: rednoise

content: Hi - email provide is Google gmail. Not sure if POP3 or IMAP - don't know how to check this. Tried the Folder Repair but that hasn't solved my problem. Old emails are again being restored after deletion (both in Thunderbird Inbox & Deleted folders and then again in Gmail Bin via Firefox). Thanks for the thought but the problem seems to be more difficult to solve. Simon.

content: - click 'account settings' - highlight the name of the desired account to be default in left column. then click the 'set as default' button in upper right - if you desire it to appear above the other one, just drag the account name in 'account settings' pane as desired. - I defer to others on your color question
